contentrichtext.text: [[Image:IC 2602.jpg|200px|thumb|right|The [[open cluster]] IC 2602.]] '''[[Index Catalogue|IC]] 2602''', also known as the '''[[Theta Carinae]] Cluster''' or '''Southern [[Pleiades]]''', is an [[open cluster]] in the [[constellation]] [[Carina (constellation)|Carina]]. It was discovered by [[Abbe Lacaille]] in 1751 from [[South Africa]]. The cluster is at a distance of about 479 [[light-year]]s away from [[Earth]] and can be seen with the [[naked eye]]. The Southern Pleiades (IC 2602) has an overall [[apparent magnitude]] of 1.9, which is 70% fainter than the [[Pleiades|Taurean Pleiades]], and contains about 60 stars. [[Theta Carinae]], the brightest [[star]] within the open cluster, is a third-magnitude star with an apparent magnitude of +2.74. All the other stars within the cluster are of the fifth magnitude and fainter. Like its northern counterpart in [[Taurus (constellation)|Taurus]], the Southern Pleiades spans a sizeable area of sky, approximately 50 [[arcminutes]], so it is best viewed with large binoculars or telescope with a wide-angle eyepiece. The cluster is thought to have the same age as the [[open cluster]] [[IC 2391]],<ref> {{cite journal|title=Rotational Velocities and Chromospheric/Coronal Activity of Low-Mass Stars in the Young Open Clusters IC 2391 and IC 2602|author=Stauffer, J.R.|journal=Astrophysical Journal|volume=479|issue=2|pages=776|bibcode=1997ApJ...479..776S|doi=10.1086/303930|year=1997|display-authors=1|last2=Hartmann|first2=Lee W.|last3=Prosser|first3=Charles F.|last4=Randich|first4=Sofia|last5=Balachandran|first5=Suchitra|last6=Patten|first6=Brian M.|last7=Simon|first7=Theodore|last8=Giampapa|first8=Mark}} </ref> which has a [[lithium depletion boundary]] age of 50 million years old.<ref> {{cite journal|title=Spectroscopy of Very Low Mass Stars and Brown Dwarfs in IC 2391: Lithium Depletion and Hα Emission|author=Barrado y Navascues, D., Stauffer, J.R., & Jayawardhana, R.|year=2002|journal=Astrophysical Journal|volume=614|issue=1|pages=386–397|bibcode=2004ApJ...614..386B|doi=10.1086/423485|arxiv = astro-ph/0406436 }} </ref> ==References== * [http://www.space.com/spacewatch/spacewatch.html Space.com] {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.seds.org/messier/xtra/ngc/i2602.html The Southern Pleaides @ SEDS IC objects pages] * [http://www.starrynightphotos.com/southern_sky/southern_pleiades_ic_2602.htm Image Southern Pleiades(IC 2602)] ==See also== * [[Theta Carinae]] star {{sky|10|42|56|-|64|23|42|479}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ic 2602}} [[Category:Carina (constellation)]] [[Category:IC objects|2602]] [[Category:Open clusters]] [[Category:Caldwell objects|102b]] {{star-cluster-stub}} {{Link FA|it}}
